about: This course is for beginner students who wants to learning web development.
JavaScript, often abbreviated as JS, is a programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification.
React is a free and open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces or UI components.
AngularJS is a JavaScript-based open-source front-end web framework for developing single-page applications
Vue.js is an open-source model–view–viewmodel front end JavaScript framework for building user interfaces and single-page applications.
Ruby is an object oriented language typically used for server side development.
Python is one of the most commonly used programming languages today and is easy for beginners to learn because of its readability.
MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.
Programmers mainly use PHP mainly to write server-side scripts. But developers can also use this language to write command-line scripts.
It is best suited for applications on Windows, Android, and iOS, as it takes the help of the integrated development environment product, Microsoft Visual C++.
C++ is an enhanced version of C. Many developers today skip learning C on its own, while others think learning C first provides a valuable foundation for C++.
TypeScript is a programming language developed and maintained by Microsoft. It is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript and adds optional static typing to the language
Kotlin is used extensively for Android apps, web application, desktop application, and server-side application development.
Go was developed by Google in 2007 for APIs and web applications. Go has recently become one of the fastest-growing programming languages due to its simplicity.
Java is one of the most common, in-demand computer programming languages used today.
An open-source programming language that is easy to learn, Swift supports almost everything from the programming language Objective-C.
Programmers use Matlab to build machine learning and deep learning applications. Matlab-based programs enable users to analyze data, create algorithms, process images, and verify research.
R is an open-source language that is essentially a different version of the S language. Much of the code that developers write for S runs on R without modification.
